lines.text: E. PEPPLES
B&W Participation in CCs Campaign
J. K. WELLS, III
October 3, 1978
Attached is the latest listing's of the numbers of hours spent
by BaW employees in California on CCs business during B&W
time.
The average of the fijures is strikingly low and a substantial
number of people show zero hours.
an understanding of why the reported hours spent in ccs
I have asked Hoyt Higgins to look into the situation and get
activities on B&w time are so low. Hoyt believes that many
of the salesmen are spending a significant amount of time
on ccs activities and he gave several good illustrations.
Thus, in many cases the low number of hours shown may mean
that the employee is doing most of his Ccs related work on
his own time. Hoyt will iet me know what he finds out.
Zero hours showing on the report for an individual means that
a card was received for that week listing zero hours, A
blank indicates that no card was received from the indicated
individual covering that week. Letters are sent automatically
on a weekly basis to employees who did not submit cards reminding
them that a card must be turned in even if it shows zero hours.
Some of the blanks are the results of terminations.
J. K. W.
/tae
Attachment
